snippet: The prosecution of James E. Holmes combines some of the most contested concepts in American law — sanity, an impartial jury and the pressure for punishment in a deeply wounded community.
abstract: Participants in the case against James E Holmes for the Aurora, Colo, shootings will face several difficulties, including the question of Holmes's sanity, their own impartiality and the pressure for punishment in a deeply wounded community.
lead_paragraph: The prosecution of James E. Holmes combines some of the most contested concepts in American law — sanity, an impartial jury and the pressure for punishment in a deeply wounded community.

headline.seo: James Holmes Case Raises Complex Legal Issues
headline.main: Tough Legal Issues Converge in Colorado Shooting Case
headline.print_headline: Tough Legal Issues Converge In Colorado Shooting Case
